snippet: A law that restricts access to abortion — the admitting-privileges requirement — was blocked by a federal judge. His opinion should serve as a model for other courts.
abstract: Editorial applauds Federal Judge Myron Thompson's rejection of Alabama law requiring doctors at abortion clinics to have admitting privileges at local hospital; notes Thompson's arguments that law, far from protecting women's health, would actually harm them; holds decision constitutes victory for Alabama women and should serve as model for other courts.
lead_paragraph: A law that restricts access to abortion — the admitting-privileges requirement — was blocked by a federal judge. His opinion should serve as a model for other courts.

headline.main: A Judge Rules for Alabama Women on Abortion
headline.print_headline: A Judge Rules for Alabama Women
